content.description: Climb rock that looks chossy but seemed like enough traffic has cleaned it off, through several bolts which are spaced close together trending up and right.  Then you get into your typical NRG orange rock with big moves over slick rock.  Finally gain a ledge where you can sit or lay down before tackling the final section.  Looking up you realize you might be in trouble when the anchors and final 2 bolts are all within a 10ft section of rock.  At the last bolt find the hidden crimper or go for a wild compression sequence to the lip of the cliff.
content.location: a little uphill of the left side of a cave

content.description: Climb up the ramp until you can place gear out right and then move up to the right hand dihedral. Climb the clean finger crack on good rock. If only it were longer...
content.protection: Gear to #1.  Bolted anchor with rings
content.location: Shared start with [Submitted to The Committee for Approval].  Between Tipping Point and Jolly to be Rogered

content.description: Start the same as Climate Change but head left after the first bolt.  Continue up easier moves to a sequence where it gets a little steeper and the holds get smaller.  There seems to be multiple paths here to take but eventually you make it to a hold with a plant growing out of it and a dirty slab.  Try to find the sequence to get on to the slab and move up to a stance directly beside a tree.  A final few hard to read moves brings you to the anchors and a great view of the dam.
Follow the gear up the face making some moves to the right in the middle. The climbing/rock quality is good, there just isn't enough of it.
content.protection: Small to medium cams - Bolted anchor with rings
content.location: Around the corner to the right of The Last Glacier.

content.description: Climb through some longer moves and good holds to a ledge.  From here, when in doubt, arete.  Interesting movement through multiple smaller ledges and arete moves to a large ledge.  Continue up the arete and eventually pulling over onto a slabby section on the arete and gain a final stance at the anchors.  Be sure to look right at a great view of the dam.
content.location: around the corner from Tipping Point

content.description: Climb up the ramp to a perch below the left dihedral, climb increasingly difficult moves up thru the wide crux. Can be climbed on a standard rack, just be conscious of the ramp below you. Having a #5 or #6 would make the wide bit feel less desperate. Move up and right to the shared anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack to #3. A #5 or #6 could be used.  Bolted anchor with rings
content.location: Between Tipping Point and Jolly To Be Rogered.  Shared start with Salt The Earth
